member.name: T:Fundamentals.Sorting.InsertionSort
member.summary: Insertion sort is a simple sorting algorithm that builds the final sorted array (or list) one item at a time. It is much less efficient on large lists than more advanced algorithms such as quicksort, heapsort, or merge sort.

member.name: T:Fundamentals.Sorting.ISort
member.summary: Exposes a method that sorts the elements in a one-dimensional array.

member.name: M:Fundamentals.Sorting.ISort.Sort``1(``0[])
member.summary: Sorts the elements in an entire using the generic interface implementation of each element of the Array.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements of the array.
member.exception: One or more elements in array do not implement the generic interface.
